How to Install tar-split on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • tar-split

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install tar-split on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing tar-split on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall tar-split in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install tar-split, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install tar-split Using apt

To install tar-split in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install tar-split using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install tar-split

The installation of tar-split might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install tar-split Using apt-get

To install tar-split using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install tar-split.

sudo apt-get -y install tar-split

Install tar-split Using Synaptic

To install tar-split using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install tar-split on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for tar-split. This will display the tar-split package in the package window, now to install tar-split, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the tar-split package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of tar-split.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install tar-split Using aptitude

To install tar-split on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of tar-split.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install tar-split using the command aptitude install tar-split.

sudo aptitude -y install tar-split

How to Upgrade tar-split on debian

If you want to upgrade the tar-split package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade tar-split using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade tar-split to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade tar-split.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade tar-split sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade tar-split

Upgrade tar-split using Aptitude

To upgrade tar-split using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade tar-split.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade tar-split

Upgrade tar-split using Synaptic

To upgrade tar-split using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for tar-split, now right-click tar-split, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade tar-split just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall tar-split on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall tar-split from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just tar-split, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove tar-split

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of tar-split

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of tar-split you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge tar-split

Remove tar-split using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall tar-split using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for tar-split, right-click the tar-split package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall tar-split click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install tar-split on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade tar-split using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of tar-split then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
